page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Our area covers from the Stone Age to Modern Times. There are many places of interest eg. Jarlshof. Many different people have arrived and settled in our area leaving their cultures and traditions. At Jarlshof <on West Voe> there is evidence from 8 different eras. The earliest, a hut, dates from about 2000BC. From the Iron Age 2 examples of dwellings were discovered and from later on a Viking Hall and farmstead. A farm was established in Medieval Times and lasted until the 16th century. After this a large house was built for the Laird. This is now in ruins. There are many remains of Brochs in our area built by the Picts for defence. They were built in a circular fashion with tunnels connecting living spaces. The stones from these have
